Waypoints.Name: Large organ introduction
Waypoints.Description:
The kidney in this example is a 5um slice from a FFPE block of a healthy XX year old XXmale. The Morphology markers used were DAPI for Nuclei (blue), PanCK antibodies vs cytokeratin to mark epithelial tissue, and CD10/CD31 antibodies to mark xxx tissue. The kidney was probed with the GeoMx human WTA assay [link to paper?].
The kidney has two major structures the Medulla and Cortex with glomerular filtration occurring in the Cortex, whilst the nephron extends across the boundary between medulla and cortex with the collecting duct system being cortical. Here you can see all Regions of Interest (ROI) as well as highlight the Medulla and Cortex

Waypoints.Name: Finer resolution physiology introduction
Waypoints.Description:
In this diagram the key features of the nephron are highlighted, and representative structures can be viewed.

Selection of regions
GeoMx DSP selects Regions of Interest (ROI) then uses photo cleavage to collect barcodes from Areas of Illumination (AOI). The power of DSP is that it can collect either an AOI that is the whole ROI (geometric), or it can use the morphology markers to segment the ROI into separate compartments (segmented)
1. Collecting Duct CD10 and PanCk +ve -segmented
2. Loop of Henle CD10 and PanCk +ve -segmented
3. Distal convoluted tubule CD10 -ve and PanCK+ve - segmented
4. Proximal Convoluted Tubule - geometric
5. Glomerulus CD10 Geometric Selection
6. Filtration Membrane CD10 +ve and PanCk -ve (segmented)

Waypoints.Name: Molecular and Spatial Data
Waypoints.Description: One of the key aspects of spatial biology is the ability to link molecular and spatial (image) data. In this figure the average number of genes detected per ROI by structure is shown. Select the box plot to see the ROIs for that structure.

Waypoints.Name: Cell Type Deconvolution
Waypoints.Description:
This figure uses cell deconvolution algorithm [(Danaher et al bioRxiv)](https://doi.org/10.1101/2020.08.04.235168).
The cell deconvolution algorithm gives the proportion of cells of each type in the AOI. This deconvolution used a cell type matrix from XXX. Each row is a single AOI. Each structure has a distinctive signature in terms of cell types of proportions.

Waypoints.Name: Known pathways
Waypoints.Description: Because the ROI were probed with the whole transcriptome it’s possible to analyze pathways as well as individual genes. In this figure a heat map of pathway enrichment. xxxxxx. For clarity only a few structure types are shown. There are signatures of pathway enrichment by structure and pathways connected with the function of each structure are enriched.

Waypoints.Name: Volcano plot
Waypoints.Description: Using WTA facilitates hypothesis generation, in this case a heat map shows that there are differences between Cortical and Juxtamedullary glomerulus. Cortical nephrons (85% of all nephrons) mainly perform excretory and regulatory functions, while juxtamedullary nephrons (15% of nephrons) concentrate and dilute urine.

Waypoints.Name: Recapitulate 50y of kidney research
Waypoints.Description:
We explored the relationship between our data and the [Human Proteome Atlas](www.proteinatlas.org) Uhlén M et al., Tissue-based map of the human proteome. Science (2015). In this case NPHS2 is a marker for Glomerulus as seen in the image below.

![image](img/NPHS2_IHC.png)

[*image credit: Human Protein Atlas.*](https://www.proteinatlas.org/ENSG00000116218-NPHS2#gene_information)

The gene expression levels recapitulate the observed protein distributions being only observed in the glomerulus and filtration membrane(to check).

Waypoints.Name: Segregate by histological substructure
Waypoints.Description: tSNE plot shows that the different regions segregate with glomeruli and filtration membranes having smaller separations than the tubules, as expected if gene expression is related to function.
